arm_group.description: proton magnetic resonance spectroscopy for asymptomatic women breasts.

brief_summary.textblock:
To delineate if the chemical composition (lipid and water) in the presumably normal breast
      of the high risk women is different from those of the low risk group.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Study of Breast MRI Screening and Proton Magnetic Resonance Spectroscopy

detailed_description.textblock:
The researchers would like to investigate and compare the chemical composition in the normal
      breast between high risk women and general population.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Women without breast symptoms

          -  25-75 years old.

          -  Negative mammography result in recent 6 months

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  renal function impairment

          -  past history of anaphylactoid reaction to MRI contrast media (Gd-DTPA)

          -  pregnant or lactating women

          -  medication of HRT or oral pills in recent 6 months

          -  past history of surgery of the breast (either side)

          -  past history of breast cancer

          -  with breast implant or silicone injection

          -  past history of cardiac surgery, mechanical valve replacement, aneurismal clip,
             endotracheal tube or tracheostomy tube, any metallic implants.

intervention.description: proton magnetic resonance spectroscopy was performed for the normal breast to evaluate the chemical composition of breast

clinical_study.official_title: The Study of Breast MRI Screening and Proton Magnetic Resonance Spectroscopy

primary_outcome.description: This is a cross sectional study. And we just assess the chemical composition of normal breasts of women at a given time point, since the participants only received one time of study.
primary_outcome.measure: comparison of lipid water composition and ratio of the normal breasts in women of high risk group and low risk group.
primary_outcome.time_frame: up to 5 years ( July 2008 to June 2013)

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

responsible_party.investigator_title: physician, clinical assistant professor, principal investigator of Department of Medical Imaging

secondary_outcome.description: to investigate whether there is association of breast density and chemical composition of normal breast on proton magnetic resonance spectroscopy.
secondary_outcome.measure: to investigate the association between breast density and lipid water ratio of normal breasts

secondary_outcome.description: to investigate whether there is association of menopausal status and chemical composition of normal breast on proton magnetic resonance spectroscopy.
secondary_outcome.measure: to investigate the association between menopausal status and lipid water ratio of normal breasts
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 5 years ( July 2008 to June 2013)

clinical_study.study_design: Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Basic Science
